projects.name: Beat-It
projects.description: 2D rhythm game where the player controls a character and must hit markers that come from above and below. The game features different modes: a single-player mode where the player can upload their own music to convert it and adjust the difficulty to create a challenging experience, a two-player multiplayer mode, and a boss mode. Currently, the game is no longer being updated.

projects.name: Social Engineering Security Auditor Software
projects.description: It is a cybersecurity auditing tool designed to identify vulnerabilities in systems through controlled social engineering simulations. Its implementation involves sending an .exe file, which can be obfuscated to make its analysis more difficult. If the audit is successful, the information can be sent to Telegram or Discord. This tool is for private use only and is no longer supported.

projects.name: Malware Analysis Sandbox Laboratory
projects.description: An open-source educational tool designed to simulate and analyze the behavior of malware in a controlled environment. The software provides a user-friendly interface where users can select specific functionalities to simulate a malware-like behavior. Upon execution, the program displays a clear and non-intrusive notification on the target machine's screen (e.g., a label in the top-right corner) indicating that the system is part of a simulated infection for educational purposes. This ensures safe and ethical usage while providing valuable insights into how malware operates.

competitions.name: Hackathon 2025 by CloudWeGo
competitions.description: Cloud-native microservices struggle with protocol fragmentation (Thrift/REST), causing code bloat and performance loss (30% overhead with HTTP conversion). The goal is to enhance the Kitex framework with a dual-protocol engine. The top solution will join CloudWeGo’s open-source ecosystem to eliminate protocol barriers and accelerate microservices globally.
